line_1: 'To trample o'er and slight a Pin.
line_2: 'Who held it was a crying Sin,

line_1: SH—T—R, who never car'd a single pin
line_2: Whether he left out nonsense or put in,
But to the house went in.

line_1: Nor for the criticks cares a pin;
line_2: He dashes on through thick and thin,

line_1: Her night-gown fasten'd with a single pin;
line_2: Warm from her bed, to me alone within,

line_1: With many a Chain, and Bolt, and Pin.
line_2: To keep Rogues out, and Riches in;
If at TOYSHOP I step in,

line_1: Rent from the Corps, on yonder Pin,
line_2: I hang the Scales that brac't it in;

line_1: Vulcan shall make the silver pin.
line_2: The basket thus we shall begin,
